Memorandum: - In June 1946 the Bahrain Government wrote to the Senior Naval Officer in the Persian Gulf stating that the Government was prepared to offer Rs. 10,000/- for a launch which was being sold, as it was then thought, by the Naval authorities at Jufair, on the assumption that a new propeller would be supplied. No reply was given to the Bahrain Government to the letter making this offer so in August I wrote to the Sea Transport Officer, Basrah, saying that it was assumed that the offer was not acceptable. The Senior Sea Transport Officer in the Persian Gulf informed the Commanding Officer, Jufair, that our offer was accepted and that the propeller was dispatched. In October I received a letter from A.C.D.O. regarding spares for the launch, m th no reference to a propeller followed by a subsequent letter from the A.C.D.O. stating that our offer had been accepted and enclosing Sales Voucher. >■ Without the propeller the launch is useless, further, since June 1946, its condition has deteriorated. Our offer was made with the condition that a new propeller should be supplied. That has not been done. Under the circumstances the Bahrain Government is not prepared to purchase the launch, I enclose, for your information, copies of the relative correspondence as it is possible that the A.C.D.O. may refer the matter to you. titleInfo.title: 'File 3/28 Sale of naval dhows and motor craft'

physicalDescription.extent: The papers are arranged chronologically from the front to the rear of the file.
Foliation: The foliation system in use is the sequence of numbers appearing in the top right hand corner of each page.

mods.abstract: Correspondence concerning the sale of naval dhows in the Royal Naval Base, Jufair. Descriptions of the naval dhows are listed with their dimensions and description of their hull and engine. Correspondents include Mr Cornelius James Pelly, Political Agent, Bahrain; Charles Dalrymple Belgrave, Adviser to the Bahrain Government; Senior Naval Officer Persian Gulf.
